Serdar Akkol, MD

PhD Student

Updates Publications Blog

I am Serdar Akkol, MD, an aspiring physician-scientist. I am interested in understanding “the theater of mind”. I use neuroimaging and electrophysiological recordings to understand various cognitive processes like language and diseases like epilepsy. I would like to translate the knowledge I obtained and produced into the care of patients with neurological diseases.

I graduated from Istanbul University, Cerrahpaşa School of Medicine in June, 2018. After receiving my medical degree, I started to work with Dr.Josef Parvizi as a postdoctoral scholar at Stanford University until May 2019. To pursue my ideal to be a physician-scientist, I started my PhD with Dr.Stephan Bickel and Dr.Ashesh Mehta at the Feinstein Institutes for Medical Research at Northwell Health.

My plan is to start my Neurology residency in 2022 as an MD-PhD. Looking forward to #Match2022!

Important Updates:

  • March, 2021 - Published my work on Periventricular Heteropias in Journal of Neuroscience
  • October, 2020 - Poster presentation at Advances and Perspectives in Auditory Neuroscience (APAN)
  • June, 2020 - Poster presentation at BRAIN Initiative Investigator's Meeting
  • June, 2019 - Started Elmezzi Graduate School of Molecular Medicine
  • October, 2018 - Started Post-doc at Stanford University
  • July, 2018 - Graduated from Istanbul University Cerrahpaşa School of Medicine
  • February, 1993 - About me
